```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aws/sdk/v6/go/aws/verifiedaccess"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := verifiedaccess.NewTrustProvider(ctx, "example", &verifiedaccess.TrustProviderArgs{
			PolicyReferenceName:   pulumi.String("example"),
			TrustProviderType:     pulumi.String("user"),
			UserTrustProviderType: pulumi.String("iam-identity-center"),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```

```csharp
{
    PolicyReferenceName = "string",
    TrustProviderType = "string",
    Description = "string",

    {
        TenantId = "string",
    },
    DeviceTrustProviderType = "string",
    NativeApplicationOidcOptions = new Aws.VerifiedAccess.Inputs.TrustProviderNativeApplicationOidcOptionsArgs
    {
        ClientSecret = "string",
        AuthorizationEndpoint = "string",
        ClientId = "string",
        Issuer = "string",
        PublicSigningKeyEndpoint = "string",
        Scope = "string",
        TokenEndpoint = "string",
        UserInfoEndpoint = "string",
    },

    {
        ClientSecret = "string",
        AuthorizationEndpoint = "string",
        ClientId = "string",
        Issuer = "string",
        Scope = "string",
        TokenEndpoint = "string",
        UserInfoEndpoint = "string",
    },

        CustomerManagedKeyEnabled = false,
        KmsKeyArn = "string",
    },
```

```java
var trustProviderResource = new TrustProvider("trustProviderResource", TrustProviderArgs.builder()
    .policyReferenceName("string")
    .trustProviderType("string")
    .description("string")
    .deviceOptions(TrustProviderDeviceOptionsArgs.builder()
        .tenantId("string")
        .build())
    .deviceTrustProviderType("string")
    .nativeApplicationOidcOptions(TrustProviderNativeApplicationOidcOptionsArgs.builder()
        .clientSecret("string")
        .authorizationEndpoint("string")
        .clientId("string")
        .issuer("string")
        .publicSigningKeyEndpoint("string")
        .scope("string")
        .tokenEndpoint("string")
        .userInfoEndpoint("string")
        .build())
    .oidcOptions(TrustProviderOidcOptionsArgs.builder()
        .clientSecret("string")
        .authorizationEndpoint("string")
        .clientId("string")
        .issuer("string")
        .scope("string")
        .tokenEndpoint("string")
        .userInfoEndpoint("string")
        .build())
    .sseSpecification(TrustProviderSseSpecificationArgs.builder()
        .customerManagedKeyEnabled(false)
        .kmsKeyArn("string")
        .build())
    .tags(Map.of("string", "string"))
    .userTrustProviderType("string")
    .build());
```

</pulumi-choosable>

    <dd>The <em>unique</em> provider ID of the resource to lookup.</dd>
    <dt class="property-optional" title="Optional">
        <span>state</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Any extra arguments used during the lookup.</dd>
    <dt class="property-optional" title="Optional">
        <span>opts</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>A bag of options that control this resource's behavior.</dd>
</dl>

</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import Transfer Workflows using the  `id`. For example:

```sh
$ pulumi import aws:verifiedaccess/trustProvider:TrustProvider example vatp-8012925589
```


To learn more about importing existing cloud resources, see [Importing resources](/docs/using-pulumi/adopting-pulumi/import/).
